name: British and Foreign Bible Society Instituted
obverse: An angel flying right holding a scroll. Below the angel is the earth. Around the medal, below the outer inscription, are stars.
obverse_inscriptions: GLORY TO GOD IN THE HIGHEST AND ON EARTH PEACE: GOOD WILL TOWARD MEN
reverse: Inscription in 9 lines. Above the inscription is the sun with 'JEHOVAH' written in Hebrew in the center. Below the inscription is a bible within a wreath.
reverse_inscriptions: THE BRITISH AND FOREIGN BIBLE SOCIETY INSTITUTED 7T.H. MARCH 1804. FOR THE CIRCULATION OF THE HOLY SCRIPTURES. WITHOUT NOTE OR COMMENT. IN EVERY LANGUAGE. OF THE WORLD.
description: This medal commemorates the founding of the British and Foreign Bible Society in 1804.

Though this medal is listed in BHM under the year 1804, Wyon (the engraver) was only 9 nine years old at that time. This medal was exhibited by Wyon at the Royal Academy in 1821 which is likely when this medal was actually struck.
